timeline.bodyText: params is never null. Furthermore, you should use  ConversionParameters.readBooleanParameter here.
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: params may be null when called from specific unit tests. A Conversion Parameter has been added to the CgmesExport class. By the way, the generic Exporter interface does not define getParameters like its Importer counterpart.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Not sure why an exception is thrown? We could just ignore it.
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Check has been removed.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Don't really think it should be a property? I think it should use a parameter cgmes.export.base-name (if not filled, use network.getNameOrId()). Ideally, it should also be a field in CgmesExportContext but I will probably do it in a later PR.
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Defined a new BASE_NAME parameter in CgmesExport.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Done. Defined a single try-with-resources block for export SV and SSH export
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: To confirm, but maybe it might be a good idea to use the extension in powsybl-balance-adjustements . I will look into it.
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: We will analyse the powsybl-balance-adjustements extension for a later refactoring.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Is it useful? If the RegulatingControl only regulates generators, we can put the targetDeadband as 0.
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: We tried to keep the original value read from input data, even it is not applicable in IIDM for generators. Some regulating controls in conformity test cases have targetDeadband != 0.
replies.author: zamarrenolm
annetill

timeline.bodyText: Just for me, the modifications in this class regards the updating of the original SSH export? If yes, it may be easier to review in another PR...
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Yes the modification is related to SSH export. The change was very small (only visibility of inner class), so we decided to include it here.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Not sure it is warranted. Is it useful to keep information that are not consistent? I understand it is useful for debug purposes but is there another usecase where this information is meaningful?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: We want to keep original regulating control information without changing the current logic about its use in IIDM.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Does it happen when this method is called?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: yes it could happen
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Does it happen when this method is called?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: yes, it could happen; we keep the same logic that when regulating control is processed
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: See questions above
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: trying to keep original data about regulating control
replies.author: zamarrenolm

replies.bodyText: Why do we need the targetValue as property as we have it in IIDM ?
replies.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: Same remark as for generators: if a regulating control only regulates svc, maybe we can considerate the deadband is 0 and not keep this information from the CGMES file.
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: trying to keep original data about regulating control (the conformity tests contain examples of deadband != 0)
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Just for me, can a generating unit be linked to several synchronous machines?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Yes, a GeneratingUnit can contain one or more synchronous machines. From CGMES doc, a GeneratingUnit is defined as A single or set of synchronous machines for converting mechanical power into alternating-current power.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: This method is private. If we are sure the regulatingControlId is not null when the method is called, it is not useful for me to check it.
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Done
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Do you need this because it is done after combination? Can't it be done the same way for hidden and non hidden tap changers?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: they must be done in a different way for hidden and not-hidden. Hidden after combination do not exist in IIDM Network, and non-hidden properties are taken from Network object.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Can you explain this comment to me?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: This is a comment relevant if we try to build a generic ModelDescription class. In general a single file CGMES XML can contain references to multiple profiles. For example an EQ file may contain references to EquipmentBoundary, EquipmentCore, EquipmentOperation (if it is node-breaker), ShortCircuit, ...
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Delete this empty line
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: Removed
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: I am not sure we have to support this as we don't have the use-case (or the workflow) because it could lead to bad choices for the extension CgmesSshControlAreas. It could be a generic extension shared by UCTE and CGMES workflows. This extension can be an extension of a voltage level or a substation, that only say in which control area the voltage levl or the substation belong. And then, we will have a processing to compute the net position each time, without storing it.
timeline.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: We don't have an extension for that ? What is the difference with ActivePowerControl ?
timeline.author: annetill

replies.bodyText: Do we really need a property ? Increase an extension ?
replies.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need all these properties ? We have most of these information in IIDM tap changer, no ?
timeline.author: annetill

replies.bodyText: We have to use IIDM model in priority.
replies.author: annetill

replies.bodyText:
@zamarrenolm How much does it happen?
Another thing: for a hidden tap changer, I would rather have an extension than a lot of properties...
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: @zamarrenolm If it doesn't happen a lot and if there is no physical sense, we can afford to lose them (maybe with a warning?)
replies.author: miovd

timeline.bodyText: For hidden combined tap changer: see my comment about the two modes of the conversion. I am not sure we have to support that in the mode USING_ONLY_NETWORK_PARAMETER.
timeline.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: I am really not sure about this extension as we don't have the use case.Maybe we have to accept to not support these fields in the beginning.
timeline.author: annetill

timeline.bodyText: params is never supposed to be null, I think it is okay to throw a NullPointerException if it happens (otherwise, it would have a different behavior than the other exporters and that might be weird)
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText:
Sorry, I always thought parameters in Exporters.export API could be null. In fact TestExporter in package com.powsybl.iidm.export and a few related tests use parameters == null.
Also, I followed the XmlExporter, where the parameters are used in the createExportOptions method, that finally ends in the ConversionParameters.readParameter method, where parameters is explicitly checked for null, so null is also allowed in iidm-xml-converter.
Am I right ? Am I missing something ?
replies.author: zamarrenolm

replies.bodyText:
You are right parameters can be null, I stand corrected!
However, an issue remains: it means network can't be exported using only network when params is null, why is that? The test params != null should be removed for me
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: Totally right, there is no need to check for params != null. The ConversionParameters.readBooleanParameter will take care of parameters received as Properties, ignoring them if they are null or overriding configuration if they are provided.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: I think this method can be static
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: fixed
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Maybe add a TODO comment
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: added TODO comment
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Why is it necessary?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText:
For phase tap changers, the subtype of tap changer (Linear, non-Linear Asymmetrical, non-Linear Symmetrical) must be stored as a property because the subtype class name is required for proper SSH export. The XML element must be named with the subtype. An example for the MicroGrid test case:
  <cim:PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical rdf:about="#_6ebbef67-3061-4236-a6fd-6ccc4595f6c3">
    <cim:TapChanger.step>10</cim:TapChanger.step>
    <cim:TapChanger.controlEnabled>true</cim:TapChanger.controlEnabled>
  </cim:PhaseTapChangerAsymmetrical>
In PowSyBl all phase tap changers are tabular, and there is no other way to recover this information from the IIDM PhaseTapChanger object, so we decided to save it as a property.
replies.author: zamarrenolm

replies.bodyText: Okay! In this case, I wrote it in SSHExport file, but in export, the default type should be tabular
replies.author: miovd

replies.bodyText: You are right, I fixed the default value (PhaseTapChanger is an abstract class in CGMES, a subtype must be used, and default should be PhaseTapChangerTabular, according to IIDM modelling).
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: I didn't find out where you added the regulatingControlId of transformers?
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Is this case supposed to happen? If not, throw an AssertionError
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: AssertionError thrown
replies.author: zamarrenolm

timeline.bodyText: Maybe call it shuntType?
timeline.author: MioRtia

timeline.bodyText: I think it is not the case when this method is called but the defaultType should be tabular
timeline.author: MioRtia

replies.bodyText: You are right, I was using PhaseTapChanger as default type for phase tap changers, but that is an abstract class in CGMES and can not . The right default value por tap changers, if no type information is provided in properties, should be PhaseTapChangerTabular.
replies.author: zamarrenolm
